sub_title: Co-owner / Scrummaster / Experienced Software Engineer at IT-Champs
summary:
I worked since 2007 as a developer for different clients. Next to my role as developer I started in 2011 with supervising graduate students and since 2015 with leading teams as a scrum-master. In the future I planned to do less developing work and focus more on managing and coaching teams/people. 

Specialties: Software development, C, C++, C#, Perl, Ruby, Unix, ZigBee, UML, Agile/Scrum

profile_positions.description:
Machine hardware re-design
At Scentronix work is being done on a machine that consists of many sensors and actuators. In the first design these are all linked to one central computer which consists of a Teensy processor with a large number of expansion boards. This must be replaced by a network of smaller processors, so the machine is more scalable and there is more computing power to collect more data from the sensors and actuators. The hardware has already been made and consists a master board and around 50 slave boards, both based on stm32 microchips. The board are connected to each other via a bus system. The master board has a serial connection over which commands are sent. The master ensures that the slaves execute the commands correctly.

Responsibilities
In a team of 2-3 persons I am responsible for the architecture and implementation of the completely new code base. Part of this new codebase is the protocol used over the bus connection, the serial communication, the possibility of distributing and installing new firmware, handling commands to the various slave boards and collecting data throughout the system.

Programming languages: C, C ++, Python
Methods: SCRUM, DevOps, TDD, BDD, CI / CD
Tooling: Eclipse, STM32Workbench, STM32CubeMx, Jira, GitLab, Cucumber (behave).
profile_positions.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Within ASML there is an improvements project for various
improvements of the development environment for the
EUV-Source developers. This mainly consists of Ruby tooling
that makes it possible to work consistently with code from
200+ SVN repositories and to release that code in the form
of patches. This is done via the SCRUM method and, BDD
and unit tests are used for quality assurance. In addition, we
provide support on a number of older tools that have not
yet migrated to the new suite that was created in Ruby.

Responsibilities
As Teamlead and scrummaster I am responsible for this
project and I am also developing. I am getting along with the
customer and stakeholders to get the requirements on
paper to follow-up with the design, implementation and
testing of the code.

Program languages: Perl, Ruby, Bash, Groovy
Methods: SCRUM, DevOps, TDD, BDD, CI / CD
Tooling: Atlassian stack(Jira, Bitbucket), ServiceNow,
Subversion, Linux, Cucumber, Jenkins, Splunk, Rspec, Rubocop.
profile_positions.title: Teamlead / Scrummaster

profile_positions.description:
EUV Source improvements
Within ASML there is a project for the development of
various programs that are used by the EUV-Source
developers. This team consists of about 12 people working
in parallel on 10+ applications.

Responsibilities
The development and rollout of the CWBD application
(Check Work Before Delivery, Perl). In addition, I started
with the project manager to introduce a more Agile way of
working. The result is that we now work from 3 SCRUM
teams, each with their own specialism. As scrummaster of
all 3 teams I have made a start on a more agile approach.
Within 1 of the teams, responsible for the patch tooling
(Ruby), I work as a developer and am also responsible for
the design, the architecture and the drafting of the
requirements together with the customer / stakeholders.

Program languages: Perl, Ruby
Methods: SCRUM, TDD, BDD
Tooling: Atlassian stack(Jira, Bitbucket), Subversion, Linux,
Cucumber, Jenkins
profile_positions.title: Scrummaster

profile_positions.description:
As a IT-consultant I worked last years for different clients. Each client has its own challenges. (different sector, people, techniques and methods)

Next to my job as consultant I supervise graduate students since 2011.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Experienced Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Graduation supervisor / coaching
CGI offers students the opportunity to graduate within the
company. In order for this graduation period to be
successful, these graduates must be supervised by a
company supervisor.

Responsibilities
I am partly responsible for creating the graduation
assignments, recruiting and on boarding the students. In
addition, I am the process supervisor of the students and I
also ensure that the students get a real picture of CGI and
the activities within CGI. I also help the students by sharing
my own knowledge or to help the students with
connections within CGI.
profile_positions.title: Graduate supervisor

profile_positions.description:
PCB Design and implementation
For different purposes such as training sessions and open
days, a number of prototypes are needed to demonstrate
hardware and hardware programming in a workshop.

Responsibilities
I have worked on the development of both the hardware
and the software for several prototypes. I have designed the
PCBs with Multisim / Ultiboard and Eagle. After etching and
soldering I wrote the software for the microprocessor in C.
The whole is delivered with a clear manual. It always
concerns circuits with state-machine behavior and limited
complexity. On the basis of the various prototypes
developed, dozens of copies have already been made.
These products were then taken into use without further
problems.

Program languages: Embedded C
Tooling: Multisim/Ultiboard, Eagle, Visual Studio
profile_positions.title: Embedded Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Managed Lighting Control
The development of an infrastructure to wirelessly control
a large number of lighting units from a PC.

Responsibilities
Responsible for defining the project and designing and
implementing a number of subsystems. This mainly
consisted of writing the demo program with C#.

Program languages: C#
Methods: RUP
Tooling: Visual Studio
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Philips hue bridge
The Philips hue bridge is being expanded with new
functionalities. These functionalities often align with
changes to other components in the Philips hue ecosystem,
so the coordination between these parties is important.

Responsibilities
I am co-responsible for the implementation and
development of the new functionalities. (C / C ++) and the
associated unit tests (C #). I also work on process
improvements. In addition, I work closely with the
integration test team to detect operational problems.

Program languages: Embedded C, C++, C#, Python, nunit
Methods: SCRUM, DevOps, TDD, BDD, CI / CD
Tooling: Atlassian stack(Jira), Subversion, Jenkins,
Wireshark, Eclipse, FreeRTOS
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Philips hue Livingcolors
Within Philips, a team has been formed from which the next
generation of hue lamps based on a Zigbee platform will be
released.

Responsibilities
I am co-responsible for the implementation (C / C ++) and
the associated unit tests (C #).

Program languages: Embedded C, C++, C#, Python, nunit
Methods: SCRUM, TDD
Tooling: Subversion, Jenkins, Wireshark, Eclipse
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Philips hue
At the end of 2011, a team was set up to make a product
that uses a Zigbee platform made by Philips. The product
consists of lamps, a bridge, a portal and mobile phone apps.

Responsibilities
I am partly responsible for the implementation of the
software for the lamp and the bridge consisting of C / C ++
code. In addition, unit tests had to be made (C#). I have
arranged a CI / CD street so that the code is automatically
built and tested. I also had to transfer my knowledge of the
Zigbee platform to the other team members.

Program languages: Embedded C, C++, C#, Python, nunit
Methods: SCRUM, TDD
Tooling: Subversion, Jenkins, Wireshark, Eclipse, FreeRTOS
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Philips hue Zigbee Platform
A platform for Zigbee products is being developed within
Philips Lighting. This platform must ensure that no specific
Zigbee knowledge is required for the production of (Zigbee)
products.

Responsibilities
I have been working for a while to gain knowledge of the
platform so that I can later use it in a product team. During
this period, I also effectively developed some features
within the platform.

Program languages: Embedded C, C++, C#, Python, nunit
Methods: SCRUM, TDD
Tooling: Subversion, Jenkins, Wireshark, Eclipse
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Maintenance and improvement
An NXP employee who supported the application
"YieldManager" left NXP. YieldManager is in short, the
program that collects all measurements from wafers.

Responsibilities
I have taken over the YieldManager application and am fully
responsible for the maintenance and improvements to this.
The activities consist of identifying problems and solutions
together with the internal customers. Adjusting the code
(Perl) and designing the application because a lot of
information has disappeared with the departure of the NXP
employee. I have rewritten part of the code in order to
introduce a better maintenance-friendly structure. Now the
rest of the code can also be rewritten using the new
structure.

Program languages: Perl
Tooling: Unix, vi
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Maintenance and improvement
Maintenance and improvements on different parts of the
entire system in the FAB (Chip Factory). The software runs
on a Unix environment.

Responsibilities
It is necessary to be able to understand someone else's code
in a short time in order to be able to search for the solution.
The modified parts must be properly tested to prevent
problems with the patch being rolled out.

Program languages: C, C++, Perl
Tooling: Unix, vi
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Migration DEC Alpha to Itanium
Performing a regression test on the Shop Floor Control
system of the FAB (Chip Factory).

Responsibilities
Responsible for the correct execution of the test scenarios.
The tests must be carefully done to ensure that no problems
arise during the rollout. Most of the tests are done in the
program MosView, the program were the operators work
with at the factory. A part of the tests is also done in a Unix
environment with the help of scripts.

Tooling: Unix, vi, MosView
profile_positions.title: Software Tester

profile_positions.description:
Release Smart Card - Set Top Box
Perform various tests on Set Top Boxes (STBs) and a newly
developed smart card. The tests are aimed at establishing
possible incompatibility of the STBs with regard to the new
smart card.

Responsibilities
By analyzing the data traffic between STB and smart card
incompatibility problems can be found and solved.
profile_positions.title: Software Tester
